verses.verse: (A Shiggaion <WH7692> of David, which he sang to the Lord <WH3068> concerning Cush, a Benjamite.) O Lord my God, <WH430> in Thee I have taken <WH2620> refuge; <WH2620> Save <WH3467> me from all <WH3605> those who pursue <WH7291> me, and deliver <WH5337> me,
Lest <WH6435> he tear <WH2963> my soul <WH5315> like a lion, <WH9030> Dragging <WH6561> me away, <WH6561> while there <WH369> is none <WH369> to deliver. <WH5337>
O Lord <WH3068> my God, <WH430> if <WH518> I have done <WH6213> this, <WH384> If <WH518> there <WH3426> is injustice <WH5766> in my hands, <WH3709>
If <WH518> I have rewarded <WH1580> evil <WH9563> to my friend, <WH7999> Or have plundered <WH2502> him who without <WH7387> cause <WH7387> was my adversary, <WH6887>

Let the enemy <WH340> pursue <WH7291> my soul <WH5315> and overtake <WH5381> [it]; And let him trample <WH7429> my life <WH9132> down <WH7429> to the ground, <WH776> And lay <WH7931> my glory <WH9202> in the dust. <WH6083> Selah. <WH5542>

Arise, <WH6965> O Lord, <WH3068> in Thine anger; <WH639> Lift <WH5375> up Thyself against the rage <WH5678> of my adversaries, <WH6887> And arouse <WH5782> Thyself for me; Thou hast appointed <WH6680> judgment. <WH4941>
And let the assembly <WH5712> of the peoples <WH3816> encompass <WH5437> Thee; And over <WH5921> them return <WH7725> Thou on high. <WH4791>
The Lord <WH3068> judges <WH1777> the peoples; <WH5971> Vindicate <WH8199> me, O Lord, <WH3068> according to my righteousness <WH6664> and my integrity <WH8537> that is in me.

O <WH4994> let the evil <WH9563> of the wicked <WH7563> come <WH1584> to an end, <WH1584> but establish <WH3559> the righteous; <WH6662> For the righteous <WH6662> God <WH430> tries <WH974> the hearts <WH3820> and minds. <WH3629>
My shield <WH4043> is with God, <WH430> Who saves <WH3467> the upright <WH3477> in heart. <WH3820>
God <WH430> is a righteous <WH6662> judge, <WH8199> And a God <WH410> who has indignation <WH2194> every <WH3605> day. <WH3117>
If <WH518> a man does not repent, <WH7725> He will sharpen <WH3913> His sword; <WH2719> He has bent <WH1869> His bow <WH7198> and made <WH3559> it ready. <WH3559>
He has also prepared <WH3559> for Himself deadly <WH4194> weapons; <WH3627> He makes <WH6466> His arrows <WH2671> fiery <WH1814> shafts. <WH1814>
Behold, <WH2009> he travails <WH9111> with wickedness, <WH205> And he conceives <WH2029> mischief, <WH5999> and brings <WH3205> forth <WH3205> falsehood. <WH8267>
He has dug <WH3738> a pit <WH953> and hollowed <WH2658> it out, And has fallen <WH5307> into the hole <WH7845> which he made. <WH6466>
His mischief <WH5999> will return <WH7725> upon his own head, <WH7218> And his violence <WH2555> will descend <WH3381> upon his own pate. <WH6936>

I will give <WH3034> thanks <WH3034> to the Lord <WH3068> according to His righteousness, <WH6664> And will sing <WH2167> praise <WH2167> to the name <WH8034> of the Lord <WH3068> Most <WH9411> High. <WH9411>
